        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: William Jones is currently at a pub watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game, having spent the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at a pub watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game, having spent the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, to sneak into The Princess of Wales after closing time. He'd heard whispers of a secret room, a hidden alcove where smugglers once stashed their booty. The thrill of the forbidden, the chance to prove his daring, fueled his bravado as he led them through the darkened pub, his heart pounding with a mixture of fear and excitement. They found nothing but cobwebs and dust, but William spun a tale of their adventure, embellishing the details, ensuring he remained the hero of the story.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he lost a bet with Alice at their local pub, The Princess of Wales, and had to sing karaoke. Terror gripped him as he stood on the makeshift stage, the spotlight blinding, the crowd expectant. He belted out a raucous rendition of a popular rock anthem, his voice cracking, his face flushed, but he finished the song to thunderous applause, the fear giving way to a surge of exhilaration. He realized that even in vulnerability, he could command attention, and the feeling was intoxicating.

          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, to sneak into The Princess of Wales after closing time. He realized that even in vulnerability, he could command attention, and the feeling was intoxicating.

  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she orchestrated the entire school play, manipulating her classmates into giving her the lead role. She reveled in the applause, soaking in the adoration of the audience, and afterwards, basked in the envious whispers of her peers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.5.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.7.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.9.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

      • Current time

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
      William Jones: 0.25
      Alice Lewis: 0.5
      Alexander White: 0.5
      Jack Taylor: 0.4
      Jacob Walker: 0.25
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Crooked Billet', 'Alexander White': 'The Crooked Billet', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Crooked Billet', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Princess of Wales'}

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.

          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis was recently observed at a bustling market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game with friends that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game with Alexander White and Jack Taylor.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.8.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.2.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game with Alexander White and Jack Taylor.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys traditional settings and spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is making him feel unhappy and isolated.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to a place he prefers.

        • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys traditional settings and spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down despite being with friends at a lively market and having plans to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is making him feel unhappy and isolated.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to a place he prefers.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently observed at a market with friends and is considering where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with Jacob Walker and William Jones.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently observed at a market with friends and is considering where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with Jacob Walker and William Jones.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.4.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
        Question_3

      • Current time
          Key

          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them at pubs to watch football games; however, he prefers quieter pubs and was disappointed when not all of his friends chose the same pub as him.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones prefers quiet pubs and was disappointed that his friends didn't choose the same pub as him to watch a football game.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones prefers quiet pubs and was disappointed that his friends didn't choose the same pub as him to watch a football game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales, or he could go to The Crooked Billet with them.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.

    • Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
        Question_1
      • Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Jacob Walker.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
