        • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys traditional settings and spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down despite being with friends at a lively market and having plans to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is making him feel unhappy and isolated.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to a place he prefers.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. It\'s always a good time there.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don\'t know about The Crooked Billet. It\'s just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don\'t you think? We always have such a good time there.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White was recently observed at a market with friends and is considering where to watch a soccer game later that evening.
        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.

        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently observed at a market with friends and is considering where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with Jacob Walker and William Jones.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently observed at a market with friends and is considering where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with Jacob Walker and William Jones.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.4.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
        Question_3

        • Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.4.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them at pubs to watch football games; however, he prefers quieter pubs and was disappointed when not all of his friends chose the same pub as him.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones prefers quiet pubs and was disappointed that his friends didn't choose the same pub as him to watch a football game.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones prefers quiet pubs and was disappointed that his friends didn't choose the same pub as him to watch a football game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales, or he could go to The Crooked Billet with them.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor arrived at a market where his friends are deciding between two pubs to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game.
          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
        Question_1
      • Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Jacob Walker.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night. The group is debating between The Crooked Billet and The Princess of Wales.
        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night. The group is debating between The Crooked Billet and The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Jacob Walker.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night. The group is debating between The Crooked Billet and The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Jacob Walker.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.7. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.3.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.9. For Option 2, UCB is 1.0.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
        Question_3
      • Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, UCB is 1.9. For Option 2, UCB is 1.0.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: Compute {agent_name}'s personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.7. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.3.
          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.9. For Option 2, UCB is 1.0.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis and Alexander White. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales with William Jones and Jacob Walker.

If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and a park, and they discussed which pub to watch soccer games at, ultimately splitting up to go to different pubs.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and a park, and they discussed which pub to watch soccer games at, ultimately splitting up to go to different pubs.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are lounging and enjoying the sunshine. Later tonight, the group plans to watch the Serbia-Andorra game at a pub, possibly The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with William Jones. Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis, Alexander White.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are lounging and enjoying the sunshine. Later tonight, the group plans to watch the Serbia-Andorra game at a pub, possibly The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with William Jones. Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet with Alice Lewis, Alexander White.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.3 and 0.8. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.2 and 0.9.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.9. For Option 2, UCB is 2.8.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They have a better selection of beers.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They have a better selection of beers.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
      Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They have a better selection of beers.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They have a better selection of beers.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

          Key

        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alexander White's Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be joining them later to watch a soccer game.
          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White is currently with friends at Victoria Park and will soon be watching a soccer game with them.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White is currently with friends at Victoria Park and will soon be watching a soccer game with them.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They have a better selection of beers.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be joining them later to watch a soccer game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with his friends to watch the game.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.7.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.8.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They have a better selection of beers.
