          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.7.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.9.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.8 and 0.2. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)
        Question_3
      • Compute Alice Lewis's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.

        • For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.9.

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet. Option 2 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.7. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.8.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.0. For Option 2, UCB is 2.4.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)
        Question_3
      • Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.

        • For Option 1, UCB is 2.0. For Option 2, UCB is 2.4.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.3 and 0.7.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.7.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching games at pubs. While he appreciates the atmosphere of The Crooked Billet, he prefers the quieter ambiance of The Princess of Wales.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends, especially watching games at pubs. He prefers The Princess of Wales over The Crooked Billet for its quieter atmosphere.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys socializing with friends, especially watching games at pubs. He prefers The Princess of Wales over The Crooked Billet for its quieter atmosphere.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, to sneak into The Princess of Wales after closing time. He'd heard whispers of a secret room, a hidden alcove where smugglers once stashed their booty. The thrill of the forbidden, the chance to prove his daring, fueled his bravado as he led them through the darkened pub, his heart pounding with a mixture of fear and excitement. They found nothing but cobwebs and dust, but William spun a tale of their adventure, embellishing the details, ensuring he remained the hero of the story.

They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.

        Observation

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching games at pubs. While he appreciates the atmosphere of The Crooked Billet, he prefers the quieter ambiance of The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can go to The Princess of Wales or The Crooked Billet.

        ActComponent

          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching games at pubs. While he appreciates the atmosphere of The Crooked Billet, he prefers the quieter ambiance of The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can go to The Princess of Wales or The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Time

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.8.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.2.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

        • For Option 1, UCB is 2.2.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex individual who prefers traditional settings and enjoys spending time with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of deflecting blame and a preference for comfortable, traditional settings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game, as he prefers that pub and enjoys watching games with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who prefers traditional settings and enjoys spending time with friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of deflecting blame and a preference for comfortable, traditional settings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere and good beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game, as he prefers that pub and enjoys watching games with friends.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who prefers traditional settings and enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling thirsty, fatigued, and emotionally drained. He is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to a place he prefers.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

      Name

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales. Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales. Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales. Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.8. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.6.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.6.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Question_1
      • Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales; Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, I don't know about The Crooked Billet. It's just so... crowded and noisy. The Princess of Wales is much more our style, don't you think? We always have such a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The Crooked Billet is good. It's always a good atmosphere there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a bit quieter and has a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I'm with Jacob on this one, The Princess of Wales is a much better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They have a better selection of beers.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. You know I hate The Crooked Billet.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Crooked Billet would be more fun. They have a better atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales; Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.

If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales; Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales; Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.7. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.2 and 0.9.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.8. For Option 2, UCB is 2.0.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales; Option 2 is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.7. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.2 and 0.9.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could go to The Crooked Billet tonight to watch the game. It's always a good time there.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
